item.title: Academic
item.description: The highly flexible website framework for Hugo with an extensible plugin mechanism. Create a beautifully simple site in under 10 minutes ðŸš€ Latest release Star

Hi! I’m Mae! I’m an assistant professor at Princeton University, and you’ve found my mostly-research website! My research focuses on designing new Programming Languages to solve problems in Distributed Systems. I also have active, exciting projects purely in PL or DS. My students and I are part of both the Princeton (non-ML) Systems group and Programming Languages group.

item.title: Awards
item.description: NDSEG Fellowship (2015) NSF GRFP Honorable Mention (2015) Cornell CS Department Service Award (multiple, latest 2020) Senior Prize in Computer Science (2013) Rose Rosengard Subotnik Prize (2012)

item.title: Teaching
item.description: CS 294-170: Graduate Seminar: Programming the Cloud The public clouds are the most powerful general-purpose computers ever assembled, allowing individuals to rent their power at unlimited scale, on demand. This makes “the cloud” the biggest game-changer in computing access since the adoption of the PDP-11 minicomputer in the early 1970s. However, unlike the advent of UNIX and C for PDP-11, an organic programming model has yet to emerge for the cloud.

item.title: Service
item.description: Professional Service Artifact Evaluation Committee: OOPSLA ‘15, POPL ‘17, PLDI ‘19, OOPSLA ‘23 Program Committee: PaPoC ‘22, EuroDW ‘21, ‘22 External Review Committee: OOPSLA ‘23 Outreach CCF: Member of the selection committee *SIGPLAN-M: Mentor since 2020 SPLASH (2013,15-16): Instructor at SPLASH Cornell and MIT, lecturing on video game music EYH (2014-19): Workshop leader and designer at Expanding Your Horizons, a one-day workshop aimed at encouraging middle school girls to embrace STEM topics.
